column1: Option A: Each course participant is required to complete an individual project in the field of primary health care, under the direction of a supervisor. The study should be linked to the protocol developed during MFM8006. Course participants will be required to make regular presentations on the progress of the projects throughout the module. Option B: Fieldwork and applied research a. Attachment to FM clinic to develop advanced skills in family medicine: Each candidate would have 60 contact hours (4.5 credit units) with a tutor. Activities include case discussion, topic discussion, direct observation during consultation, and personal growth and development. b. Written assignment (4.5 credit units, 60 hours): Each candidate would be required to write up a clinical review on special client group, an observation study, or an audit report based on fieldwork, and the standard of which should be of publishable quality.
